title: Add visible Internet Identity login button on mobile login screen

requirements.text: Update the unauthenticated (logged-out) screen so it renders a visible, tappable sign-in button that triggers the existing Internet Identity login flow, instead of showing only the "Please log in to access the application" message.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user is not authenticated, the page shows a prominent button that can be tapped on mobile (no text-only login state).
Tapping the button starts the Internet Identity login flow (same behavior as the existing header LoginButton).
The existing logged-out message (or equivalent) remains visible along with the button so users understand why they are being asked to sign in.

requirements.text: Ensure the sign-in buttonâ€™s label explicitly says "Sign in with Internet Identity" on the logged-out screen so users understand what provider they are using.

quotes: Stuck at login no login button appears for app
From phone just a message saying login app but no button to login appears

acceptanceCriteria: On the logged-out screen, the primary button text is "Sign in with Internet Identity" (English).
No user-facing login text implies an invisible/automatic login; the user can always see what to tap.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep all user-facing text in clear English.
nonGoals: Do not change backend authentication logic or admin allowlist behavior.
Do not add new authentication providers; Internet Identity remains the only login method.
